description: The Trump administration offered “no rationale” for cutting off potentially trillions of dollars in federal funding of grants, loans and other financial assistance to recipients nationwide with less than 24 hours notice to conduct an ideological review, a judge said.
title: Judge Denies Trump Bid to Toss Out Suit Over Funding Freeze

description: M23 rebels in the Democratic Republic of Congo said they would begin a unilateral ceasefire on Tuesday as the Group of Seven nations demanded that the Rwanda-backed militia halt an offensive that has shaken the eastern part of the country.
title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels in Congo Say They Will Begin a Ceasefire

description: The Trump administration will likely choose fresh nominees to oversee the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. and Commodity Futures Trading Commission instead of installing the current acting heads of those agencies to permanently lead the regulators, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Likely to Make Fresh Picks to Head FDIC, CFTC

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior writer for economics Shawn Donnan looks at the uncertainty cause by whipsawing actions on tariffs. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Takes Markets, Businesses on a Tariff Rollercoaster

description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Monday that new tariffs on Canadian and US goods will be paused for 30 days after a call with President Donald Trump.
title: Trudeau Says Trump Tariffs Delayed 30 Days After Call

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio told Congress that the US Agency for International Development may be subsumed into the State Department and abolished as a separate agency once his team completes a review of its practices, according to a letter seen by Bloomberg News.
title: Rubio Tells Congress That USAID May Be Abolished After Review

description: The newly appointed interim US attorney for the District of Columbia said he would take legal action against anyone who impedes or threatens Elon Musk’s government-efficiency staff, raising the stakes after repeated confrontations between the group and civil servants at various US agencies.
title: Trump-Appointed DC Attorney Offers to Protect Musk’s DOGE Staff

description: Syria’s authorities are holding talks with a US-backed armed group as part of an effort to control firepower in the war-torn country, a step that would cement the new rulers’ grip after the downfall of autocrat Bashar Al-Assad.
title: Syria’s President Reveals Talks With US-Backed Group

description: Former President Joe Biden re-signed with Creative Artists Agency, returning to the talent representatives who managed him after eight years as vice president.
title: Former President Joe Biden Signs With Talent Agency CAA

description: President Donald Trump said his administration wants an agreement with Ukraine for the war-torn country to offer access to its rare earths resources in return for aiding its defense against Russia.
title: Trump Wants Ukraine to Guarantee Access to Rare Earths for War Aid

description: From the rocky shores of Newfoundland to the towering forests of British Columbia, Canadians have an unfamiliar feeling growing inside them: They are angry.
title: Canadians Boo US Anthem as They Seethe Over Trump Tariff Threats

description: This week's surprise disruption.
title: The Tariff Announcement That Shocked Financial Markets
Odd Lots: The Tariff Announcement That Shocked Markets (Podcast)

description: The Trump administration denied an extension of deportation protections for almost 350,000 Venezuelan migrants, setting the stage for their removal from the US.
title: Trump Scraps Deportation Shield for 350,000 Venezuelan Migrants

description: Outside of occasions when the US Treasury is running down its cash pile while awaiting congressional action to raise the debt limit, bond market participants don’t typically pay much attention to the department’s payments-processing division.
title: Musk’s Moves on Treasury Risk a Debate Over US Payments Default

description: President Donald Trump said Elon Musk has access to Treasury systems that allow him to monitor federal spending before payments are made, but that the world’s richest man does not have the power to stop payments himself without approval.
title: Trump Says Musk Cannot Stop Treasury Payments on His Own

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive action he said would direct officials to create a sovereign wealth fund for the US, following through on an idea he floated during the presidential campaign.
title: Trump Signs Action to Create Sovereign Wealth Fund in Next Year

description: Kenya’s treasury secretary is taking no chances with this year’s budget.
title: Kenyan Treasury Chief Climbs Soapbox to Rally Support for Budget

description: More than 900 people died in fighting for the city of Goma in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo last week, the United Nations said Monday, as African leaders agreed to meet to discuss the conflict.
title: Congo City Death Toll Passes 900 as African Leaders Plan Summit

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said he’s now in charge of the US Agency for International Development, after the Trump administration and its allies put senior staff on leave and threatened to shut it down for good.
title: Rubio Says USAID Takeover Is Needed to Fit Foreign Policy Goals

description: AstraZeneca Plc cut planned spending on research and development at a new UK vaccines facility to about £90 million ($112 million) from £150 million, a minister said, an investment decision that led the government to offer less state funding for the now abandoned project.
title: AstraZeneca Cut Vaccine R&D Pledge in Plant Funding Row, UK Says

description: Venezuela opposition leader María Corina Machado said she spoke with an envoy of President Donald Trump who secured the release of six American prisoners after a meeting with President Nicolás Maduro last week.
title: Venezuela’s Machado Says Trump Channel With Maduro Is ‘Positive’

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio oversaw a deportation flight from Panama to Colombia, an unusual move for a top US diplomat meant to highlight President Donald Trump’s focus on migration.
title: Rubio Attends Panama Deportation, Underscoring Trump’s Migration Focus

description: Friedrich Merz, the conservative frontrunner in the German election, vowed to hold course on his disputed plan to limit migration despite public protest and to restore growth to the country’s ailing economy.
title: Germany’s Merz Promises to Limit Migration and Restore Growth

description: Nippon Steel Corp. and United States Steel Corp. blamed politics and a failed review process for former President Joe Biden’s decision to block their planned $14.1 billion merger, according to a court filing.
title: Nippon, US Steel Blame Politics for Biden’s Blocking of Merger

description: Few countries are moving faster than India to appease US President Donald Trump in an effort to head off a potentially devastating trade war.
title: Modi’s Trump Strategy Sees Quick Concessions to Avoid Trade War

description: The two most senior executives at the World Health Organization have hit back at decisions by President Donald Trump to withdraw from the global health agency and suspend US foreign aid.
title: WHO Top Chiefs Hit Back at Trump Over Foreign Aid Orders

description: President Donald Trump agreed to delay 25% tariffs against Mexico for one month after a conversation with his counterpart Claudia Sheinbaum on Monday, a dramatic turnabout with the neighboring nations on the brink of a trade war.
title: Trump Delays Mexico Tariffs by a Month After Talk With Sheinbaum

description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou forced the adoption of a 2025 budget bill by bypassing the lower house of parliament on Monday, using a constitutional provision that will likely trigger a no-confidence vote.
title: French Premier Forces Through Budget, Risking Censure Vote

description: Land ownership in South Africa remains an explosive issue more than three decades after White-minority rule ended, and the new US president has added more fuel to the fire.
title: Why Trump Is Taking Aim at South Africa’s Land Laws

description: Mexico has taken steps to safeguard its economy from the shock of US tariffs and authorities are working together in case liquidity in the currency market is affected, the country’s finance minister said.
title: Mexico Assures Investors Its Economy Can Withstand Tariffs

description: Lockheed Martin Corp. is still delivering F-35 fighter jet aircraft with quality defects after 13 years of production, according to the Pentagon test office’s annual weapons-evaluations report.
title: F-35 Production Still Marred by Quality Woes, Pentagon Test Office Says

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent is now the acting head of the US Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, according to a person familiar with the matter, signaling a potential shift away from the aggressive enforcement and regulatory approach under Rohit Chopra.
title: Bessent to Temporarily Lead CFPB After Chopra’s Ouster

description: The UK Treasury has told several government departments to prepare for their budgets to be frozen in cash terms ahead of a major spending review planned in June.
title: Reeves Gives Whitehall Departments ‘Flat Cash’ Austerity Warning
Trump Tariffs Reverberate Across Global Markets

description: Young staffers from Musk’s government-efficiency initiative gained access to sensitive information to cap a weeklong effort that puts the aid agency’s fate in question.
title: Behind DOGE’s Standoff at USAID: Desk Searches and Elon Musk Calling

description: The leadership of France’s Socialist Party has decided not to support a no-confidence motion against the government over the budget for this year, according to Agence France-Presse, which cited participants in an executive committee meeting.
title: French Socialist Party Leadership Won’t Back Censure Vote: AFP

description: There is one nook in the market that took President Donald Trump’s tariff threats seriously last week: professional speculators.
title: Hedge Funds Bailed From US Equities Ahead of Trump Tariffs

description: Ontario’s premier said his government is ending its contract with Starlink, the Elon Musk-controlled satellite company, following US President Donald Trump’s executive order to impose tariffs on goods imported from Canada.
title: Ontario Cancels Starlink Deal, Bars US Firms From Government Contracts

description: Denmark is ready to allow the US to boost its presence in Greenland, Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said as she seeks to curb an escalating diplomatic crisis with the Trump administration over the world’s largest island.
title: Denmark Is Open to US Expansion in Greenland, Premier Says

description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott said he’s empowered the National Guard to make immigration arrests, the latest move by the Republican-ally of President Donald Trump to help advance a crackdown on migrants and the border.
title: Texas Hands Power to National Guard to Make Immigration Arrests

description: The Chinese-founded massive online marketplace Shein faces potential fines with the European Union imminently set to open a probe into its compliance with consumer laws over the sale of illegal products.
title: Shein to Face EU Consumer Law Probe Under E-Commerce Crackdown

description: Charities, diplomats and foreign officials around the world are frantically trying to figure out what will happen to the US agency that doles out over $40 billion in aid for everything from life-saving HIV programs in Africa to funding for Ukraine amid the Trump administration’s assault on a cornerstone of the country’s global influence.
title: Trump and Musk’s USAID ‘Shut Down’ Threat Opens Door for China

description: Democratic lawmakers in the US are asking Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to stay away from all vaccine-related decisions if confirmed as Secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services because his family could benefit from anti-vaccine litigation.
title: US Lawmakers Ask RFK Jr. to Stay Away From Vaccine Decisions

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Wields the Stick on Trade and Aid Alike

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said that Europe has the capacity to react to new US tariffs if President Donald Trump follows through on his recent threats, joining a chorus of European leaders pledging to retaliate if necessary.
title: EU Vows Trade Retaliation With Tusk Slamming ‘Stupid Tariff War’

description: Indonesia is poised to shift at least $61 billion of state assets into a powerful new investment fund that reports directly to President Prabowo Subianto.
title: Indonesia Set to Shift $61 Billion of State Assets Into New Fund

description: European governments reeling from Elon Musk’s political attacks are comparing notes with fellow targets all-too familiar with the X owner’s methods.
title: Brazil Took on Musk and Won. Now Lula Is Sharing Notes With Europe

description: Ukrainian drones struck more Russian oil and gas facilities, the latest in a near-daily series of attacks meant to hurt Moscow’s war effort.
title: Ukraine Hits Lukoil Oil Refinery, Gazprom Plant in Russia

description: Vienna-based Raiffeisen Bank International AG has been making money from firms supplying Vladimir Putin’s military, according to documents seen by Bloomberg, as the Russian army grinds forward in Ukraine.
title: Raiffeisen Bank Clients in Russia Help Supply Putin’s War Machine

description: US President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Canada and Mexico are  “worrying” and heighten economic uncertainty for Europe, Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.
title: ECB’s Villeroy Says US Tariffs Are Worrying, Raise Uncertainty

description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis called for at least €100 billion ($102 billion) in common European Union spending for defense, joining a growing number of capitals that want the bloc to take more responsibility for its own security.
title: Greek Premier Calls for a €100 Billion EU Fund for Defense

description: US oil refiners will look to Latin America and the Middle East to replace suddenly more expensive Canadian and Mexican crudes following President Donald Trump’s tariff salvo, according to traders.
title: US Oil Refiners Look to Latin America, Iraq After Trump Tariffs

description: Elon Musk, who now runs the government efficiency initiative he calls DOGE, sketched out plans for aggressive cuts to US spending and regulations that include wiping out the US Agency for International Development — and suggested the bond market should thank him for it.
title: Musk Outlines Scope of Plan for DOGE Cuts, Starting With USAID

description: The 30-year-long trend of integration and liberalization of the region’s electricity market is at risk.
title: Why Norway’s Political Crisis Is a European Energy Problem

description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou faces a make—or-break test Monday when he plans to get a new budget approved without a parliamentary vote, a risky process that could end up toppling France’s third government in less than a year.
title: France’s Premier Risks Turmoil in Budget Showdown: What to Watch

description: Friedrich Merz, the conservative front-runner in the German election, will focus his campaign on proposals to revive the struggling economy after a bruising clash last week over tougher immigration rules.
title: Germany’s Merz to Focus on Economic Policy After Migration Clash

description: Australia’s richest woman Gina Rinehart increased her donations to the center-right Liberal National opposition by more than 200% in the most recent political contribution data, as the country’s billionaires bet big on both major parties ahead of a national election that is due by May 17.
title: Australia Billionaires Pour Funds Into Parties Ahead of Election

description: North Korea lashed out at US Secretary of State Marco Rubio’s recent characterization of Pyongyang as a “rogue” state, vowing to “never tolerate” any provocation by Washington.
title: North Korea Slams Rubio’s ‘Coarse’ Remarks, Vows Tough Response

description: US President Donald Trump said he will “definitely” place new tariffs on the European Union, reiterating complaints about the US trade deficit with the bloc and what he sees as insufficient EU imports of American cars and agricultural products.
title: Trump Says Tariffs Will ‘Definitely Happen’ With European Union
